page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: Some of the houses in our "D" block have beams.The{thatch}was originally tied to the beams with raw hide.Raw hide is strong{material}.Some houses have been restored but there are still some pieces of the original hide left. The walls of these old houses are made of wattle and daub.This is made up of lime and pieces of chopped straw.The daub comes in slats.The local building is chalk.Flint is often used to decorate the walls of houses. Some houses just have chalk slabs on the floor.In old houses the window sills are quite low. Houses would only have one window in each room,the window would be on the North side. Some houses have{pargetting},there are two types of pargetting.There is one where it is inscribed into the wall and another when it is moulded.
